item.source: remeber how great vice city was

item.title: remeber how great vice city was
item.dc:creator: Navitas
item.description:
To me GTAIV lacked atmosphere. Perhaps because it felt so normal to me.

Vice city was a blast from the past with neon lights and iconic music, and San Andreas had the whole gangster thing going with huge environments and tons of side missions. Those were awesome.

Now I love Just Cause 2. It has a crap story and even worse acting, but it was so open with the stunts you could do and just messing around with such a simple thing like the tether.
It’s crazy stuff like the jump jet and open landscape from San Andreas that I missed from GTAIV.

Different games I know, and I will just go and play more Just Cause 2 instead, but to get me excited about GTA like I used to, I want some cool toys to play with in game.
I’m hoping that the next GTA delivers.

Oh and I LOVE it in 4 when you steal a car and the victim grabs hold of the handle for a ride I guess the main thing 4 had was ragdolls.

Read full topic

It was terribly ported in almost every respect, even if you were able to put the game to run decently on your computer, there also were other big problems, like shitty vehicle controls.

item.source: remeber how great vice city was

item.title: remeber how great vice city was
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
I find it pretty unfair to rate GTA4 down because it doesn’t have as much shit to do as the others before it.

GTA4 was a complete reboot of the series, not a direct sequel and they rebooted it with a much bigger emphasis on the story than on the sandbox mechanics and honestly, seeing the route they were starting to go down with San Andreas, if they kept just adding more and more shit to do, GTA4 would be way too fucking bloated and/or silly.

Rockstar had to decide on either focus on the story or on the sandbox mechanics/contents and they chose the story, and to be honest, they made the right choice.

If you want a sandbox crime game where you can just fuck around being silly, there’s always Saint’s Row.

Read full topic
